site_name: Bear Basin Butte Lookout / Pierson Cabin
fee_info:
Overnight Use: $75 per night, rate is for 1 to 8 persons; $5 per night for each additional person over 8, paid directly to the facility (usually when picking up the key). The maximum occupancy is 12 persons.
$75 per night. Rate is for 1 to 8 persons; there is a fee of $5 per night for each additional person over 8, paid directly to the facility (usually when picking up the key). The maximum occupancy is 12 persons.
restrooms: Restrooms are available at this site.
water: Potable water is not available at this site.

fee_info:
Day Use:
$8 per vehicle per day
Additional Vehicle Fee: $5 per vehicle per night
$8 per vehicle, $5 per extra vehicle
directions: From the visitor center turn right onto 199 and drive 7.2 miles west. Turn left onto to South Fork Road (County Road 427). The sign will also read Howland Hill Scenic Drive, Stout Grove, and Myrtle Beach. Go ½ mile and bear left at the “Y” intersection to stay on South Fork Road. Continue for 14 miles and turn left on County Road 405. Campground entrance is 1/4 mile on the left.
restrooms: Restrooms are available at this site.
water: Potable water is not available at this site.

Overnight Use:
Single Site: $10  per night

$10 camping fee - $5 for extra vehicle, $5 day-use fee for day use of campsites. Cash (exact change) and check, made out to USDA (United States Department of Agriculture)
directions: From Willow Creek, California, take State Route 299 for 2 miles west. Enter the campground directly from the highway.

fee_info:
Day Use:
$5 per vehicle per day
Overnight Use:
Single Site: $10 per night
Additional Vehicle Fee: $5 per vehicle per night
$10 per night for camping; $5 extra vehicle fee; $5 for day use. Envelopes are available at the fee board.
directions: From the South, take State Route 96 North ( off of State Route 299 in Willow Creek) and proceed for 60.2 miles. The campground will be on the left hand side.From the North (Interstate 5), take State Route 96 south west, past Happy Camp, for 85.7 miles. The campground will be on the right hand side.

season_of_use:
~ 6/1/25 - ~ 10/14/25. Dates may vary due to wet weather and/or Port Otford Cedar
root disease. For updates call (530) 627-3291. Closed for winter months.
fee_info:
Day Use:
$5 per vehicle per day
Overnight Use:
Single Site: $10 per night
Additional Vehicle Fee: $5 per vehicle per night
$10 per night for camping; $5 per extra vehicle; $5.00 day use fee.
directions: From the West, follow Highway 101, just one mile North of Arcata. Follow California State Route 299 East for 30 miles to Willow Creek. Take State Highway 96 North 30 miles to Weitchpec. Continue 4 miles to Bluff Creek Road (Forest Road 13N01). Follow Bluff Creek Road 5 miles to Fish Lake Road, Forest Road 10N12 (turn off on right) and continue for 3 miles to Campground entrance.From the East, turn on to State Route 299 in Redding, and proceed West for about 95 miles to Willow Creek. Take State Highway 96 North 30 miles to Weitchpec. Continue 4 miles to Bluff Creek Road (Forest Road 13N01). Follow Bluff Creek Road 5 miles to Fish Lake Road, Forest Road 10N12 (turn off on right) and continue for 3 miles to Campground entrance.
restrooms: Restrooms are available at this site.
water: Potable water is not available at this site.

directions: From the Visitor Center travel west on Highway 199 for 2.6 miles; turn right onto Forest Road 17N49 and travel 7.7 miles; turn right onto County Road 305 (Low Divide Road) and travel east 15 miles to Forest Road 18N28 which is just past the North Fork Bridge. fee_info:
Overnight Use:
Single Site: $15 per night
Additional Vehicle Fee: $5 per vehicle per night
Family campsites accommodate up to eight people per site, with a maximum of two vehicles. The fee is $15 per site per night. This fee includes one vehicle; a $5 fee is charged for the second vehicle. A vehicle is: a motor-home towing another vehicle, a single car or motorcycle, or a vehicle towing a trailer.
directions: From the Visitor Center in Gasquet, California turn left on Highway 199 and go 2½ miles east.
restrooms: Restrooms are available at this site.
